metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23192 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way samba implemented DCE/RPC. If a client to a Samba server sent a very large DCE/RPC request, and chose to fragment it, an attacker could replace later fragments with their own data, bypassing the signature requirements.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
libnss-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
libpam-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
libsmbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
libwbclient0 - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
python-samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
registry-tools - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
samba-common - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
samba-common-bin - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
samba-libs - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
samba-testsuite - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
smbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.24').
